title: Govt committed for development, uplift of youth: Suri
content:
ISLAMABAD, May 31 (APP): Deputy Speaker National Assembly Qasim Khan Suri here Monday said that government is committed for the development and uplift of country’s youth.
Speaking at a signing ceremony of Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Youth Parliament of Pakistan (YPP), Young Parliamentary Forum (YPF) and Pakistan Institute of Parliamentary Services (PIPS) Suri remarked that Pakistani youth has potential to bring socio-economic development in the country. He said that despite COVID-19 challenges, the 4 percent GDP growth reflects the resilience of Pakistan’s economy.
Chairman YPF Ibrar ul Haq termed this MOU as a window opportunity for youth. Federal Minister for National Food Security and Research Syed Fakhr Imam also witnessed the ceremony .
